result.execSummary:
The defendant Alan S Rae was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: 9:29 Defendant Alan S Rae in court with attorney Jessica Phelps.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea hearing at 02-05-2016 09:00 am

ADDRESS INFO for Alan S Rae
Current: 899 Highway 73 South Lot 23, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494 United States  (Effective: 01-06-2016)
Prior: 364 Buehler Avenue, Nekoosa, WI 54457 United States
Jury trial - 12 person at 02-24-2016 08:15 am

3:28 Defendant Alan S Rae in court with attorney David R. Dickmann.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Dickmann asks for sequestration of witnesses.
Brandon Burroughs is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Zell. He is a deputy with the Wood County Sheriff's Department. He was dispatched to the Township of Saratoga on 4/12/15 regarding a complaint of unauthorized purchases on a credit card. It was for pizzas and they were delivered to a residence in the City of Wisconsin Rapids, Wood County. He attempted to make contact with the residence on Chase Street. He spoke to defendant on the phone and defendant stated he did not know anything about these charges. Attorney Dickmann cross-examines witness. He observed a video from one of the pizza stores where someone was taking a photo with their phone of the purchase screen. Attorney Zell redirects.
P.T. is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Zell. She is self-employed, owning a pizza restaurant in Wisconsin Rapids. Testifies as to deputy asking about an order being placed. Exhibit #1,Daily Order Summary, is marked and reviewed with witness. She states the defendant was an employee of the restaurant. While searching the order for the officer, she observed video footage of defendant taking a picture of the order screen with his phone. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. She states defendant stopped coming to work after the officer was at the restaurant. Attorney Dickmann cross-examines witness. Attorney Zell redirects. Attorney Dickmann cross-examines witness. Exhibit is received.
Attorney Dickmann makes statement. 
Attorney Zell makes statement.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bound over for further proceedings. Bond is continued.
Witness Fees for Preliminary Hearing - $17.60
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment at 12-18-2015 03:30 pm

10:49 Defendant Alan S Rae in court with attorney David R. Dickmann.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Dickmann explains that Rae was sitting in Branch 1 as directed by the Bailiff and Clerk of Courts office.  Atty Zell indicates that the witnesses are gone and he is unable to get ahold of the citizen witness.  Warrant is cancelled.  Matter is reset for Preliminary Hearing.  Atty Dickmann Waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court extends time.

10:35 Attorney David R. Dickmann in court.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State requests warrant. Court orders warrant. No bond.
(Defendant)

Preliminary hearing and Arraignment at 11-09-2015 10:30 am

Defendant Alan S Rae in court with attorney Emily M. Nolan-Plutchak.  Defendant Alan S Rae in custody.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions probable cause. Attorney Nolan-Plutchak motions court to dismiss case.  Probable cause found.  Bound over for preliminary hearing.
Body Only.  Unable to Serve.
